author: {'steamid': '76561198034979373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2305, 'last_played': 1591155057}
review:
What can be said for a game like Frozen State? A lot. 
It's a great game in that it's genuinely tense. The stakes are high and you can't just reset the gambles you make. I have been playing it since, I think about the first month it came to Steam, and it has changed dramatically. 
When I first bought it, I was afraid at first, it would be the same generic kind of survival game that has been washing up on the shores of Steam like rotten flotsam. Frozen State is like a big, ice coated barge crashing into the shore and unleashing a horde of the undead onto your normal beach going day. 
I have some key things to say about it. The first is that I survived 20 days. That is my current maximum. I found the Mansion, and it was there I died. 
Word of warning? Humans Aren't your friend. But I did find a car, and by god, that was the most satisfying feeling on the planet to be able to avoide the Piercers, Jackals, Widows and other horrible monsters occupying the wastelands. I could explore so much easier and take a nice deep breath knowing I had a moment of peace. 
I expect the developers will eventually take the feature of beaing safe in a car, away, but if I could ask them not to, it would make playing the game in the future so much easier.

The game is like the era of Playstation 2 horror titles like the Silent Hill series, it's filled with suspense. Every action you do could give you away or get you killed if you aren't careful. I would even say this is a tougher game than Don't starve and I Love how ruthless that game is.

I hope for so much of this game, and that's why I delayed my initial review but as it stands, this game is WORTH your 10 dollars. It is Worth your time. The game is hard, which it should be. It's survival horror and it places a hard pitch on the actual survival aspect. If I hadn't been stupid? I could have gone on for probably close to another 30 days with the supplies I found, but one wrong decision, one wrong choice and you're done. Example? I had gotten to the point to use a series of molotovs and had 6 fistfuls of fire to chuck at Reapers in one of the houses and I was an idiot and caught myself on fire. The heat, the sound, it drew the Jackals and I booked it like a mad man back to my car just to slather Stas in Burn Ointment to compensate for my own recklessness. I barely escaped, but I did by the skin of my teeth. 
On a technical level I will give a moderate review as follows:

Graphics: Appropriate - It could be better, but I understand the level and it's satisfactory. I can see things, I know what stuff is. I can make out details and it does the job more than enough.

Difficulty: Hard - This isn't Minecraft. This isn't Don't Starve. This is a hard game with definite rules and hard physics in play. Sure you can carry 13 logs in your inventory, but the point is that you need to be careful and cutthroat with what you have and what you take. You can't just plop down some bricks or garbage and block your enemy and you are lucky if outrun your enemies. Don't expect an easy start. 

Gameplay: Stern but fair - This sounds like a difficulty but as mentioned in the previous sections of this review, this game is about what you are willing to do and how careful you are to prepare for the Icepocalypse surrounding you. It is fun, sneaking past your enemies, hoping to god their cone doesn't spot you so you can get home, getting your base built, HAVING A GUN (with limited bullets) SO YOU DON'T HAVE TO MELEE ENGAGE; all these aspects are some of the rewarding elements to it. Being lucky and being careful are the greatest measure a player can have aside from their own preparedness. 

Current Cons and suggestions: 

Character progression is hard. I wish the developers would consider giving you some of the Level-Up Pills every 5, to 10, to 15 days. I have had such a hard run of the game because I couldn't become tougher in-game, only smarter in how I play. 
I wish you could make matches out of gunpowder or maybe use infected meat to make like tallow or some kind of grease to make some kind of natural igniter.
Maybe a lantern not like the flashlight you can build out of scrap metal that you can place would be nice.
If there were anything else, right now that I could ask for? Maybe either the ability to armor plate your car with scrap metal or maybe a scrap metal sword or knife so you can make a spear or have something other than the nailed club or axes to kill stuff with.


Overall opinion: The game is hard, it's like squeezing water from rocks, but when you get it together it can be so much fun. And while I appreciate the game being hard, as it should be, I wish that the guy I killed at the Manor had dropped at least his axe. All he dropped was bedsheets. To bandage my bitch ass up. 

Beginners tips? 
Stones can be thrown as distraction items to lure enemies away.
Behind your house is an underground silo thing that you can access in the back-left corner, usually in there are the thermometer and watch. Sometimes a bed and a workbench. It usually has a plethora of goodies in it. 
Crafting will be your biggest ally as some of the weapons you make are invaluable, and you need to upgrade it to make your armor and weapons better.
ALWAYS CARRY SPARE FIRES AND MATCHES and when you find an extra sleeping bag? That also.
Trying to upgrade your weapons can cause them to break. I lost my starting axe and a double barreled shotgun this way. Upgrades are always a gamble.

Buy it out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022212313', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1488848286}
review:
Ожидал большего от игры из-за положительных отзывов, НО увы разочаровался. Возможно после альфы будет играбильно для меня.

Лютые зомби, которые вас быстро переломают или отравят. Самое смешное, что это вылечить нельзя. Решил зайти в крафт и посмотреть как же вылечить отравление или переломы. Доступны бинты, которые лечат кровотечение и всё! Для большего списка крафта мол надо повысить навык крафта, ну хорошо. Убил несколько зомби, вроде как уровень повысился(отображения ХР я так ни где и не нашёл) и появились очки для распределения навыков, но хрен там пел. Эти очки абсолютно никуда не хотят распределяться. В итоге крафт я свой не повысил и так и дох от отравления.


Запустил ещё раз 7 марта 2017.

Игра вышла из раннего доступа, но увы осталась всё так же сырой и унылой. 
1) Отсутствие создание персонажа! А те, которые есть (3 всего) у них есть сильные и слабые стороны. Вот только разработчик нам о них не расскажет! =)
2) Управление пъяного матроса.
3) Толкового окна персонажа так и не появилось! Есть окно "Инфо" мать их волшебницу.
И мне надо угадать ещё в какой слот, что можно вставить из инвентаря.

То ли эту игру делали школьники, то ли взрослые ленивые дяди, а возможно и всё вместе.
Разработчикам желаю клепать игры по проще. Увы эта игра у них получилась из рук вон плохо.

Бета-версия.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054929370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1495648443}
review:
Frozen State - интересная игра, с до мозга костей знакомой системой. Не мало игр существует подобного плана... Но...
Зайдя в магазин в городском районе и рыская по полкам, я очень остро ощутил навеяный This War of Mine, наверно выживать приходится как там, так и тут. Если в выживалке о войне, мы выживаем в войне, то в Frozen State, мы выживаем вообще непонятно где и для чего. Мир вроде и живой в меру своих условий, это же выживание, минимум людей вокруг и враги для хардкорности ещё тебе, опять же НО... Дайте игровому миру ещё таких же героев как и вы, которые не тупо стоят в одной локации, а шарятся по местности, имеют свою цель, в конце концов, карта то не маленькая и от пол сотни живых, ни кому дурно не станет. Далее хочется заметить о неразрушаемости диванов, столов и стульев, зачем они тогда? В том же War of Mine, разрушаешь всё ради лута, тут же, нельзя разобрать ящик, ради гвоздей, ну добавьте опцию разобрать предмет, а лучше опцию взаимодействия со многими предметами (разобрать ящик и получить гвозди, на пример для крафта ящика нужно 10 гвоздей, образно, 5 досок, а при разборе получаешь 5 гвоздей и три доски)
, а то получается деревья мы рубим и то не все далеко, а только избранные... добавьте времени для вырубки больше и лут меньше и повреждение топора при вырубке на пример, но рубить можно все деревья. Есть ведь как крафт, так и анти - крафт, разбираем всё, что можно собрать. Еда, с ней всё понятно. Одежда, хотелось бы видеть свою героиню (я играю персонажем девушкой) в новой одежде которую ты одеваешь на неё, а так же отображение сумок и капающей крови при кровотечении, это мелочи, но приятно. Крафт одежды необходим, ну как минимум, сшить балаклаву я лично могу, не думаю что в таких условиях не хватит ума на это, так же шапочку к ней. Побольше одёжды на персонажа, перчатки, ботинки, а то поумолчанию, в чём она там бегает я не знаю. Оружие тоже было бы не плохо улучшуть не только в точность и урон, а например, прикрутить прицел и бить с оптики допустим как в старом коммандос, мышка превратилась в оптический прицел. Так же рукоять и прочие мелочи дающие больше возможности, это выживалка, но такие мелочи лишние не будут. Кстати как вариан, выпадение оружия из рук при атаке моба, ведь сомневаюсь, что вы удержите тот же топор, если вас саданут хвастом - шипом по моське, а для этого, ремень на автомат и оружие не выпадает при атаке, о как. Далее следуем на систему боя, она хороша, но не даёт возможности развернуться игроку, я понимаю, что в жизни всё ещё хлеще, но в жизни и поливать можно из укрытия и хоть тем же полупрясядом, я не говорю всё это добавить, но вот сделать хотя бы замедлене как на пример в Fallout 3 в бою и дать прицелиться в туловище, голову или ещё куда, а как вариант, отскочить от атаки, а при удачном попадании, как игрок так и противник, хотя бы на долечку секунд притормаживались, а не махались как на сече богатыри, которым непочём урон, ведь ранят же, а это больно. Побольше крафта, прям очень побольше. Крафт можно развивать до беспредела. Кстати оружие снарядить магазинами было бы не плохо, которые можно носить в разгрузочном жилете. Есть вышка в крафте, значет должен быть и тот кто будет на ней дежурить, а значит нужна система общины, встретил выжившего, пригласил к себе и радуетесь, так же набеги как монстров так и других выживших и так же общин на ваш домик, или целый лагерь, мы ведь выживаем, а не в одинокого героя играем. Так же можно добать как побольше перков, харизма для общения и для вербовки, удача, ну это стандартный набор, а так же трэйты типа "Меткий мастер", что даёт бонус при стрельбе или "Золотые руки" даёт плюсы при крафте, "Повар по жизни" готовит быстрее и еда насенней. А вообще я думаю, игроку можно дать выбор при создании персонажа, сам делаешь его внешность, но выбираешь одну из допустим 20 историй, по которым будет старт и дальнейшее развитие событий и отношение внешнего мира. Идей очень много, но вот воплотить их не так просто, говорить всегда проще, но вот я скажу разработчикам, не торопитесь выпускать игру в свет, чем душевнее будет продукт и качественнее, тем больше публики и конечно продаж у вас будет.
Проект очень заманчив, хорош, имеет огромный потенциал и далёкое будущее, которое при правильном развитии способно встать рядом с великим Fallout 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086882386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1504107042}
review:
First off to the developers, love this game. Very hard core survivalist, very fun very unique.

Problems/ bugs I have encountered. 
For a game still in Alpha I have only found one problem with this game. Bandages don't work and your character bleeds to death no matter what I do. I used 1 clean bed sheet to create 7-8 big bandages and nothing would stem the bleeding. Don't know why it doesn't work, food, water and clothing all work fine.

First off this game is very easy to get into, its a single player game not co op or multiplayer. 
Your enemy? The weather, starvation, dehydration, keeping warm and... people infected with a violent space parasite. 
Parasites (they look human but usually have extra probiscus mouth sticking out of where their mouth is. You used to only get medium sized ones a jackal type that runs on all fours and giant lumbering ones. Now there seems to be a fast biped runner parasite very scary if you aren't used to seeing it. A lot of fun.
Keep warm, scavenge every corner of where you are, cupboards shelves, cars even the occasional vending machine. My current record is 6 days alive. See if you can beat that.

All in all 10/10 really enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003036971', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1431517304}
review:
いまのところ、生きることだけが目的です。

食料はたくさん手に入るので、クリーチャーの対処ができるようになるとダレてきます。
一部のクリーチャーはとても強いので逃げるの一手。
そのほかのクリーチャーの一撃もかなり痛いので、慣れないうちはあっさり殺されてしまいます
最初は銃が無いとぜんぜん太刀打ちできませんが、これもまた慣れてくると、一部の凶悪なクリーチャー以外は斧とかでも対処できるようになってきます

将来的には、もっといろいろなことができるようになるらしいので、期待したいです。
まだまだいろいろなところが荒削りですが、絵が奇麗になったProject Zomboidといったところですかね。

現状はただ生きるだけが目的ですが、過酷な環境で四苦八苦したい人にはなかなか楽しめると思います。
操作にもすぐに慣れると思うし、英語のスキルも低レベルでいけます。
いくつか、翻訳サイトでも翻訳してくれないアイテムもあるのですが、そんな時は画像検索してみると、
「ああ、これか」
で、どんなものかわかるんじゃないですかね。

とにかく、食料が豊富なので、３日も生き延びれば棚の中が缶詰の山になってしまいます。
もうちょい、そういうところのバランスを調整してくれれば、やりごたえがでてくるんじゃないかと思うのですが、いまのところは、クリーチャーを対処する術を得てしまうと、なんだか作業ゲーになってしまうのが残念なところです。

現時点では、購入のオススメ！とまではいきませんが、ゾンビサバイバルが好きな人は、ウィッシュリストに入れておくことをオススメいたします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198074390411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1461713757}
review: Frozen State is a survival game with an aerial view and a few good elements going for it. Crafting, basic needs in game such as hunger, thirst, rest, and keeping warm. But a lot of that you don't learn to do in the start. The tutorial, if you can call it that, is very breif, and traveling is very confusing. Overall gameplay wise I would give it a 3/5 for now, but it is early acess and will be improving. I play Arma 3, on all low, in a 1024x768 resolution with overall distance at 10000 ( i like jets) and objects at 2000 and shadows 100. I can get around 30fps. Not very good, but playable. In this game, im not quite sure why, but with it all on low and same resolution it feels like im getting frame rates in the teens. Now I will admit, my system is pretty low end, but I play games much more intensive at better performance.  So right now I would say this game needs optimized in every way shape and form. And the map sized per location, isn't terribly large either, so a high framerate would be expected. Would I recommend this? Eh? Maybe in the future if the game improves I would right now, maybe, depends on the friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096024045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1428416392}
review:
Un Juego interesante (y me refiero a MUY BUENO) para todos aquellos que les gusta la supervivencia. 
Uno puede pasar un buen rato jugandolo (tiene Rejugabilidad al 100%)   

Se ve desde arriba y manejamos un personaje que está en un mundo apocalíptico donde todos son zombies y mutantes, tiene mucho contenido, es un Sandbox, yendo por ahí saqueandolo todo, con posibilidad de construir nuestras herramientas, equipo, cocinarnos nuestra comida, tenemos que conseguir nieve para hacer agua, ciclo dia y noche, (la noche es oscura realmente, no total, pero cuesta ver), el juego indirectamente te obliga a dormir por la noche si no tienes una linterna.  tambien talamos los arboles para conseguir madera y poder hacer fuego y construcciones, Podemos construir nuestra base, entre muchas cosas mas. El MAPA TOTAL ES BASTANTE GRANDE!!!. 

Si lo que quieren es una referencia, digamos que es como una mezcla entre The Long Dark y Project Zomboid, pero siempre manteniendo su toque particular de Frozen State.

El juego va por zonas, tenemos mapas precargados en donde nos dirigimos a la zona de "Cambio de mapa" y se realiza la transición de un mapa a otro. (no es molesto esto, al contrario es distinto a todos).  
Podemos ver el mapa que recorremos, y la ultima vez que lo vi, creo que ya tenia implementado un sistema de misiones con Npc's como un juego de Rol, pero esto es SUPERVIVENCIA!!!!.  Igual esto ultimo de los Npc no está chequeado. 

En fin, es un muy buen juego. Lo Recomiendo!. 
Saludos.

review:
The game is amazing in pretty much every regard so here is a short story of what happend to me , and its an average run as my luck goes.

So I came across a large apartment building and decided to check the top floor and work my way down , After clearing the top floor I hid away in a room with a sleeping bag , my fire and a bear trap in front of the door and I waited for the night to be over. 

After I woke up i searched the lower floor and checked the first apartment to the left where I came across a zombie that took a few shots with my pistol to kill , I checked the room and grabed an AK-45 and some power cells for a laser rifle then "BANG" down came the door to the apartment across the hall , two leapers came running towards me so i walked towards them firing and by the end of the clip I had killed one and made it to the door and legged it out of the building into the blizzard where the leaper had lost my track, it has taken a while to build up the confidence to go back in to any of those apartments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007757844', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1426618501}
review:
Frozen State e' un survival horror che sembra prendere spunto dal film "The Thing" di John Carpenter del 1982; in questo gioco dei parassiti di origine aliena hanno infettato la popolazione di una citta' siberiana, Duga 40, e il nostro compito, dopo esserci nascosti in una casa e aver quasi finito le nostre provviste, sarà quello di uscire e esplorare la zona cercando di sopravvivere per rimanere in vita.
Inizialmente possiamo scegliere tra tre personaggi, ognuno con delle statistiche diverse dall'altro; entrati in gioco (cambieranno di volta in volta alcuni degli oggetti di partenza nell'inventario) ci troveremo in una casa che sarà anche il nostro primo avamposto, un luogo dove poter depositare i primi oggetti che troviamo nelle prime esplorazioni (ci sono una gran quantità di oggetti diversi da raccogliere) e per rigenerarci.
Il gioco ha una buona caratterizzazione delle creature che incontreremo nei nostri viaggi, ognuna con le sue peculiarità e l'ambientazione (discretamente curata) riesce a farci immedesimare con il nostro alter ego e non posso che approvare la cosa.
Ovviamente la curva di apprendimento, come in tanti altri survival, è abbastanza ripida; nelle prime partite la morte è dietro l'angolo ma continuando a giocare riusciamo a capire meglio molti aspetti e a porre più attenzione nelle nostre esplorazioni dato che dovremo tenere d'occhio sia il rumore che produciamo (abbattere una porta con un'accetta può attirare chiunque sia nelle vicinanze per esempio) che cercare di osservare ogni angolo dato che la linea di vista del personaggio sarà anche la nostra, un po' come succede nella serie strategica Ufo enemy unknown.
E' a buon punto la realizzazione del gioco, mancano ancora aspetti importanti come gli NPG ma per il resto, secondo il mio modesto parere, merita la cifra che vale e considerando che io l'ho comprato ai saldi di Steam per poco più di 6€ non posso certamente lamentarmi.
Vi lascio con questo video che vi farà vedere più da vicino gli aspetti che questo gioco mette in mostra:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sBIMFBKftUU

author: {'steamid': '76561198051610436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1607904114}
review:
"If you're not dreading every single monster encounter then its not horror is it? You're just setting up a failing pest control bussiness."

If you're a fan of survival horror this is something you're gonna wanna grab.

The monster population is actually surprisingly but pleasingly small - it means its still an event as well as surprisingly and worrying when you actually run into one or two of em - instead of mowing them down by the dozen with a sword or machinegun.
 Every enemy type (but some more than others) can cause a serious amount of damage and even poison or make you bleed. Going into sneak mode and trying to get by unoticed is possible but if you get caught, panic and open fire any nearby enemies are gonna start smashing down doors and running about looking to finish your weakened ass off.
On top of this the cold is quite a serious problem - lose track of time while out scavenging for food or meds and you can find yourself after hours, in the dark, in minus twenty degrees celsius snowstorms with about five feet of visibility. You see a crumbling structure up ahead and head inside hoping to find some shelter and maybe somewhere to set up a fire and sleeping bag - only to hear the growls and footsteps of the current ocupants. Which would you prefer: sitting there next to the fire all night staring at the doorway and hoping they don't find you, or go off and try and clear the building out in both the cold and dark?

Included in the game are skills which can be upgraded with points found while generally looting or sometimes on the corpses of slain monsters. Skills include resistance (cold, posion) crafting (more items to make) strength (bare fist damage, carry weight) and more.
Also, bases. Technically a player can make any building they found and clear out their home sweet home but they also have the option of crafting four different buildings (ascending in size) almost anywhere they want. In the same "buildings" tab "homely" craftable items are avilable such as crafting tables, storage boxes and torches to spruce up your new home or refurbish your current one, and fotifications such as wooden walls and spike barricades.
Oh and did I mention that like in project zomboid and one or two other games that enemies don't appear on your screen unless you are facing them? That means to make sure a building is completly secure, every cuboard, toilet, nook and cranny much be searched. This also means that you may not notice an enemy was hiding around the corner until its picking its teeth with your bones, or that the enemies chasing you were a lot closer than you thought but didn't know until you stopped running and turned around to check.

Cons: (In order of nit-picky-ness)
Player controls, movement and combat, are pretty clunky - its next to impossible to defeat an enemy using melee without taking a few hits.
More craftable items needed - walking around with a cart full of transistors, insulation, paperclips, light bulbs etc. that sound like they may be useful in some contraption but at the moment seem to have no purpose in crafting.
Player appearence doesn't change - may seem mild but I dislike when your character doesn't change when equipping new armour/clothes. It shows clear progression and looks silly in this game when in reality you are wearing several polar bears to brave the winter colds but your character appears to be knocking about wearing jeans and a t-shirt.

I could continue nitpicking but many of these will likely be fixed after a few months or when out of early access and if, like me, you're a fan of survival horror this is a game you are gonna want to keep your eye on.

review:
I've had some fun with FS in the current state.  
Has a lot of potential, but currently not much of anything you haven't seen before in other crawler/craft games. 
CONS: Frustratingly annoying UI for inventory (knowing how much you can carry), seemingly random inventory organization and crafting, hard/impossible combat with melee vs ranged, + I have no idea how long to sleep/rest or what time of day it is... and controls are a bit sluggish.  
PROS: Over all great work for an alpha, significant polish and artistic touch in the animaitons, and graphics, huge assortment of items to gather and craft + interesting assets and lore ready for fine-tuning, cool environment elements like combo locks and bolted doors, really cool destruction physics (when destroying doors), great macro to micro engagment with map travel (a la Wasteland 2), and the enemies are pretty scary.

Can't wait to see where the devs go with FS

author: {'steamid': '76561198034676949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3163, 'last_played': 1472282618}
review:
このレビューはAlpha 0.081 Build 76に基づいて書いています。

シベリアを舞台としたSF風味のサバイバルアクションです。
プレイしていると自分まで寒くなってくるような、良い雰囲気のゲームです。

・良い所： 雰囲気作り
ゲーム中、頻繁に耳にするのは雪を踏む音と吹雪の音です。辺り一面雪景色なのも手伝って、なんとも言えない孤独感や寂寥感を覚えます。
「助けは来ない、頼りになるのは自分の力だけ」。
プレイヤーにそう思わせる雰囲気は見事ですし、サバイバルものを謳う上では大変重要な部分です。

・イマイチな所： まだまだコンテンツ不足
早期アクセスのAlpha版なので当たり前ではありますが。
現状ストーリーモードは無く、クラフトや建築要素もかなりシンプルです。ある程度物資を集めてしまうと他にすることがありません。
購入にあたっては「雰囲気だけ楽しめればいい」などの割り切りが必要になるでしょう。

以下、特徴的な部分について紹介していきます。

・物語
ゲームの舞台はシベリアの地方都市です。謎の感染症が大流行し、多くの人が死亡。かろうじて生き残った人達もおぞましい怪物へと変異してしまいました。
プレイヤーは幸運にも(？)感染症の影響をうけることなく生き残ります。しかしライフラインはストップ、食料や医薬品の供給も期待できません。廃墟を漁って物資を集め、可能な限り生き延びましょう。

・ゲームシステム
ゲーム内世界はワールドマップとローカルセクターで構成されています。ワールドマップで移動先を設定、自動移動完了後にセクターへと侵入します。セクター内では俯瞰視点で直接キャラクターを操作し、廃墟を漁ったり敵と戦ったりします。探索を終えたらワールドマップに戻り、次の移動先を決めることになります。
世界の構成は新しくゲームを始める度に変わります。ワールドマップ上でどこにどのようなセクターが配置されるかは完全にランダムです。一方、ローカルセクターは予め作成済みのマップから選択されます。しかしセクター内にもランダム要素があり、アイテムや家具の配置、敵の出現数や配置はセクターに入らないとわかりません。
ゲーム自体がコンテンツ不足ではありますが、このランダム性のおかげで意外と飽きずに遊べています。なかなかうまく作っているなという印象です。

・キャラクターの成長
個人的に一番お気に入りの部分です。
プレイヤーキャラクターにはスキルが設定されており、各スキルを上昇させることで生存が有利になります。攻撃力増加、耐性向上、上位のクラフトをアンロック、などなど。
ところがこのゲーム、キャラクターの成長はレベル制ではありません。敵を倒したりクラフトしたりしても経験値が入ったりはしません。ではどうするのか。
探索の最中に見つかる「Antrazidol」という滅茶苦茶怪しい薬物を消費することでスキルを上昇させます。
この薬物の使用が心理的な葛藤を生んでゲームの雰囲気作りに一役買っています。「アウトブレイクの原因はこの薬なのではないか？」「使う度に自分も化け物に近づいているのではないか？」。そんな事を考えながらも生き残るためにはAntrazidolを使うしかありません。
生存のためには選択肢なんて無い、この感じが実にサバイバルものだなぁと思う訳です。

・サバイバル要素
空腹、渇き、疲労といった定番に加えて、体温という重要な要素があります。
ゲームの舞台が極寒のシベリアとあって、屋外で突っ立っているだけでどんどん体温が下がっていきます。屋内にいても同様(屋外よりはマシ)。体温が低下するとHPも低下し始めるため、体温の維持と管理が必要不可欠です。
また天候と気温の変化にも注意が必要です。夜間はかなり冷え込むために外出は危険、たとえ昼間でもブリザードに遭遇すれば夜間と同じかそれ以上に危険です。
体温を上昇させる方法は複数あります。体を動かす、窓の破れていない建物に入る、キャンプファイヤーで火にあたる、スープ系の食料やコーヒーを摂取する。状況に合わせて使い分ければより長く生存できるでしょう。
上記に加えて出血、中毒、骨折といった状態異常もあります。これらは敵の攻撃で発生し、適切なアイテムを消費して治療することが出来ます。

・戦闘
現状では敵の行動もシンプルです。こちらを見つけると距離を詰めて近接攻撃、遠距離攻撃が可能であれば遠距離攻撃。敵は数種類いますがこの行動は共通しています。敵の種類に応じた行動の変化も今後の課題の一つですね。
ちなみに、プレイヤーにとって戦闘を行う利点は何もありません。キャラクターが成長することはなく、レアなアイテムを落とすことも滅多にありません。しかも戦闘に使用した装備品は劣化していきます。可能であれば避けるのが賢明です。

・装備
武器は近接武器、銃器、エナジー兵器、爆発物があります。弾薬の調達が難しいことから近接主体の装備に落ち着くでしょう。ちなみに、筆者はまだエナジー兵器を入手したことがありません。極稀に敵がドロップするらしいのですが。
防具には防御性能と防寒性能が設定されています。戦闘が予想されるなら防御優先、フィールドの移動なら防寒優先と使い分けるといいかもしれません。
エナジー兵器に代表されるように、このゲームの世界観はSF風味、さらに言えばレトロフューチャーです。インベントリのデザインもそれっぽい感じ。Falloutシリーズのような、と言えばわかりやすいでしょうか。あそこまでコテコテではないですけどね。

・開発の経緯
ゲームの内容とは直接関係ありませんが。
このゲーム、元々はクラウドファンディングでの資金調達を目指していました。しかし調達には失敗。手元にあるデモ版を何とか遊べる形にして早期アクセスで販売し、現在に至ります。
クラウドファンディングが広く知られるようになった昨今ではさほど珍しい話ではありません。それでも開発チームの「諦めねーぞ」という姿勢は応援したくなるものがあります。

・最後に
購入を検討している方はYouTubeでプレイ動画を見てから判断してください。
繰り返しになりますが、このゲームは早期アクセスのAlpha版です。未実装の機能やバグも多く、製品版になるのはまだまだ先の話です。そもそも製品版にたどり着くのかどうかもわかりません。
個人的にはオススメですけどね！

それでは、良いサバイバルライフを。

author: {'steamid': '76561198144468307', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1495869987}
review:
サバイバルホラー。
科学技術が発達したものの、謎の宇宙生物のために壊滅してしまったソビエト連邦（現ロシア）の街が舞台。
敵は怪物だけでなく、飢えや渇き、眠気。何よりシベリアだけに寒さが厳しい。水（雪）と食料集をめて、素材を漁って、薪を燃やして何とか生き残るのが目的。（Ver.0084でストーリーはない。今後も多分無い。）民家でタンスを物色していたら扉を破って現れた怪物に殺されたなんて事がないように注意深く動き回らなければならない。何せ死んだら全てリセットだから気が抜けない。外の騒音で怪物の唸り声が聞こえなかったなんてないようにイヤホンやヘッドホン推奨。
一寸操作がやり難い・分かり難い所があるけれど、さほど酷くはないし、英語が分からなくても何とかなる。（本当に分からなかったら、辞書を引くか誰かの動画を見るかすれば何とかなる程度。）
是非極寒のシベリアで怪物と隠れん坊+鬼ごっこを楽しんでみよう。

一寸だけ詳しく説明。
スキルは14種類あって、これを自分の望む生き延び方に合わせて上げて行く。徹底的に怪物を避けるのか、それとも手早く倒すのか。消費を抑えるのか、それとも余るくらい掻き集めるのか。それによって素材の扱い方も変わってくる。
ステータスは上記の飢え、乾き、眠気、寒さなどの8種類。これらが減るとHelthが下がって行く。道具を上手く使って消耗を減らす事もできる。そもそも怪物と接触しなければ怪我はしない・・・が、そんな事ができるのか・・・。
怪物も様々、毒を吐きかけてくるもの、鋭い爪のある腕が四つあるもの、2mくらいで腕が鉈になっているもの、3mくらの熊のようなものなど。対処も近付かれないように警戒する、近接武器・銃器・爆発物で倒す、箱やタンスに隠れるなどがある。
昼夜、天候の概念もある。だから晴れた昼は何とかなっても、吹雪の夜は視界が狭い上に寒さが酷い。（本物のシベリアはこんなものではないと思うが・・・。）
移動範囲は広域地図から選んで最初から何処へでも行ける。ただし、移動中は時間が経過するし、体力も消耗する。酷い時は飢えや寒さで死ぬ。

更に詳しいものをガイドに書いておいたので興味があればどうぞ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030485943', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1433626778}
review:
Frozen State e' un gioco che ricorda tantissimo il film "La cosa" di John Caroenter.
Dei parassiti di origine extraterrestre hanno infettato parte della popolazione di una citta' che si trova in un'area dal clima gelido.. la citta' e' in quarantena e noi, dopo aver quasi finito le nostre provviste, siamo costretti a lasciare il rifugio che abbiamo fortificato e che ci ha ospitati per lungo tempo.

La grafica e' ottima per un gioco in questa fase di sviluppo, anche se mancano ancora delle animazioni, come quando  salendo le scale a chiocciola si viene "teletrasportati" invece di vedere il personaggio salire poco a poco.

In questo gioco dovremo combattere la fame, il freddo e le suddette persone infettate. (ovviamente il gameplay potrebbe essere soggetto a cambiamenti radicali dato che e' in accesso anticipato).

Pro:

Il crafting e' gia' nel gioco e sembra gia' di buon livello.
Il sistema di fame e sete funziona bene.
Il sistema di malattie/ferite, e' piu' accurato che in altri giochi (c'e' anche la voce bruciature)
L'atmosfera e' di buon livello, piccoli dettagli come la pillola di cianuro nell'inventario, dimostrano il desiderio dei programmatori di farci immergere in un mondo freddo, cupo e pericoloso.

Contro:

Deve essere aggiunta piu' varieta' alle mappe
Alcune delle features per le quali esistono gia' i menu, non sono ancora attive (ma il gioco e' ad accesso anticipato)

Se volete farvi un'idea potete guardare il primo episodio della mia serie su Youtube chespero vi aiutera' a decidere se comprarlo Link: http://youtu.be/by-gfjfHWZc

author: {'steamid': '76561198043774002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1490406506}
review:
I only post a review if a game is worth playing.

Updated: 21/12/2015
Thought I would ramp-up the review now that I have had more test-time plus the devs have added, fixed and optimised (for others).

I really don't write reviews for games/titles that don't deserve them so this is a gem...

If you're looking for an unforgiving, tense and fun title then Frozen State ticks those box's. At first there is a learning curve but the experiance and self achievment pays off.

So far it contains a good fair sized map that is explorable through the style of point and click to pick locations then entering those areas to explore, loot, hunt, build and die in... and once you die you are dead for good, yes this game is perma-death... which is one of it's great characteristics.

Other features include:
Crafting weapons, food & drink, traps, medical items and building supplies. 
Building structures for living in, home defences, storage and decoration.
Hunting & Tracking of animals for food and materials.
Transport in the form of a Truck (Only found it myself, yet to get that thing running.)
Skills to pick from through leveling up by finding a specific drug.
Medical system in which you can suffer burns, poisoning, bleeding, fractures etc.
Weather system in which the majority of the time you will be needing to keep warm (as the game is based in a fictional siberian city)... along with some blizzards for visual effect that hinders your visibility.
A.I in this game is so good for a title in it's early stages... it's possible to steath around and use distractions which is probably your best bet to survive but it's possible to win fights against even the hardest of mutants through using tactics.

Has more, I know this but I have not fully tried every feature/mechinic myself.

A title to support/keep on your radar for future release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080814679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1468843873}
review:
Its a decent game, it delivers exactly what it promises. Not many/if any bugs at all.  The environment is very believable. Controls can get some getting used to.  
It is a true survival game, you scavenge while shittting your pants, i wish other better known survival games would offer this. 
Im not sure which way the devs will go with this game, however atm its just one of those games like state of decay, where you play it to kill time or bored. it becomes repetitive as there is not much to do except scavenge, there is no true base building or some kind of aim to this game, as you keep on moving to new areas as you survive, you will die eventually, some mutants are just too strong, no running away from them or barricading yourself.  Once you die you start all over again, same place.

Its almost end of 2015, I just came back to this game after a long absence, many new items, mutants and animals added. It has become a much better game, but controls are still hard.  its still  avery much survival game, get caught out unprepared and you die.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988927906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1422212984}
review:
Not yet, this game has some very glowing reviews but let me be the first to say that they are undeserved praises, this game is no masterpiece and it certainly isn't good enough yet to warrant such praise as others have slathered upon it. 

As you can see by my time played I have only roughly 1 hour of gameplay, that is simply because the controls are so damn clunky that I can hardly stand to play it any longer. While I am no big fan of top down games in the first place this one offers a very interesting feel and has much potential, but, the WASD-E interact setup is lost on top down and only served to make the controls unbearably inefficient, the game would benefit from the option to change controls from their original setting to a user preferred setting. (allow me to set key bindings) 

Another issue I found currently is that the max range of interaction is too low, if I light a campfire I end up being burned because I have to practically stand inside the fire to interact with it. Your characters movements are rough and choppy and hiding, while a neat game mechanic, is not implemented well at this point since the interactions are still in poor repair...trying to hide in a wardrobe when a gross mutated monster is chasing you takes a while since you have to find that interaction sweet spot just to get into the wardrobe. 

So, cons - Clunky, offputting controls. Poor interaction mechanics. Great music, poor atmospheric sounds. Top-down ruins the atmosphere, Choppy movements...and let me add, poorly constructed "inventory" screen...listing items? drag and drop? I feel as though I stepped back into 1999.

Pros - Survival game, if you like survival games then keep your eyes on this one. Wonderful list of lootables and craftables. Can run on low-end machines since it is graphically simplistic. 

Ultimately I cannot recommend this to hardcore survival gaming fans as it does not really deliver satisfying game play and the survival mechanics are rough at best, starving and needing to eat in just 6 hours? Dying of thirst after half a day?  I am constantly having to drink and eat and burn myself on a campfire to stay warm.

So, kids...don't waste your money yet unless you have $10 you don't mind spending...it isn't terrible but it certainly isn't what the other comments make it out to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994820104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1446678349}
review:
Surprisingly enjoyable for its position as an Alpha.

I do like the temperature system, especially how the cold doesn't just immediately kill you but rather drains health over time. Combat is a difficult as there is no way to block enemy attacks, although that might be the point as this game seems to advocate hiding and running from the monsters as opposed to actively combating them.

I am really interested in the ability to build complete structures such as cabins and the like. Although a cheaper version of a campfire would be nice, perhaps like how Don’t Starve has the normal campfires that burn out and a fire pit that you can restart if it dies without having to make another.

All in all I think this game has promise and I get a lot of playtime out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065757655', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1466908734}
review:
Великолепная игра. 

Не стоит смотреть на версию игры. Эта альфа в разы более играбельна, чем многие современные релизы. 
Отличная атмосфера.
Система боя тоже хорошо подходит для данной игры. Что бы попасть в монстра, необходимо навести курсор непосредственно на цель, а не просто направить в её сторону.
Достаточно много лута для альфы. Придает миру наполненность. Все вещи из советской эпохи, что придется по душе тем кто помнит совок.
Крафта пока не много, но и этого более чем достаточно, так как для большинства вещей не успеете найти нужные ингридиенты до того как умрете.

Абсолютно не жалею что приобрел. Игра уже сейчас стоит своих денег, так как это не простые обещания разработчиков, а уже вполне играбельный и интересный продукт.

10 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004156552', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1426095849}
review:
Frozen State - это хардкорный симулятор выживания. Начиная играть вы загнетесь пару раз, тупо от холода, но после некоторого времени принаровитесь и сможете протянуть подольше. Игра с "ранним доступом", но при этом игра ни разу не крашнулась, не сломалась, и я не увидел никаких багов. Хотя разработчикам еще предстоит много работы, и добавление кооператива в том числе. И так как разработчик не запрашивает кучу денег за игру, игра вполне стоит своих денег.
Плюсы:
+ Сложность выживания: находясь 5 минут вне отапливаего помещения вы начинаете умирать от холода, а с монстрами в рукопашную не подерешься, тогда как патроны не очень часто выпадают, поэтому приходится прятаться и убегать.
+ Разнообразие локаций. Большое количество различных построек - от деревенских домиком до многоквартирных домов.
+ Атмосфера суровой сибирской зимы, вымершие дома, остановки, заводы и т.п. Завывание ветра...
+ Крафт, прокачка, большое количество вещей
+ Огромная карта
+ Активные разработчки. Появился вопрос, спросил в обсуждениях в Стиме, получил ответ в течении часа от самого разработчика, согласитесь такое не так часто бывает =))
+ Судя по тому, что наобещали разработчики, игра еще станет на много интерестнее.
Минсы:
- Устаревшая графика и угловатость анимации.

review: Frozen State ist ein sehr schön gemachtes spiel was echt gutes surival feeling bietet. Als ich das erste mal das Spiel angemacht habe war ich sehr skeptisch. Es lief nicht ganz so flüssig und die grafik ist nicht unbedingt das wahre. Aber man muss bedenken es ist noch in der Alpha und das flüssige spielerlebnis kommt noch. Es kommt manchmal echt spannungs feeling auf und das prinzip ähnelt ein bisschen an state of decay. Geh in der Welt material sammeln und baue deine Base aus. Schlicht und einfach gesagt überlebe. Viele Dinge sind noch in Entwicklung und es existieren halt noch einige Bugs. Aber wer sich das spiel ansah und dachte das ist cool, der soll es auf jedenfall kaufen. Die entwickler sind auf dem guten Weg ein richtig gutes Surival spiel zu entwickeln. Ich habe bereits mehr als 2 Stunden damit verbracht und werde sicher nochmals 2 spielen da ich noch nichtmal 1/10 der map erkundet habe. Also wenn ihr die entwickler suporten wollt und ein gutes spiel haben wollt.... dann ab in den warenkorb damit :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971387955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1414542001}
review:
Very fun game. You get to build anywhere you want that is outdoors, which is awesome. 

I wish there where more written notes and diaries that actually tell you something. I've done 4 play throughs and searched everywhere and everything and have only found 1 note that tells you the codes to all the vending machines. That's it. :(

Overall thoughts on the game as it's still in Alpha. 7/10.

(Combat) 5/10, it's pretty fun, but will get boring after a while. It's still a challenge though at the start.

(Crafting) 7/10 It basic, It's easy. You can craft on the spot without needing a workbench, and even build large structures.

(Building) 8/10 It's easy and fun. You can freely build anywhere you want, except indoors if it's a wall or barricade. The rotating is slow and you can only rotate one way. So if you mess up your angle, you'll need to restart.

You get resources back after taking something down you've built, which is good.

(Cooking) 5/10 You get quite a few different cooking options for the food you've gathered. Some foods need to be prepared by crafting them with some water so it can be cooked in a fire or stove. You cannot plant and farm anything in the game, so most of the food you will find are packets of oatmeal, rice, tea, instant coffee, etc. 

Instant coffee is one of the best things you can find. It will recover your Body temp, fatigue, and thirst all in one when crafted and boiled into a Hot cup of coffee.

(Monsters) 4/10 Even though they are hard to kill when outnumbered, there are only 3 types. 1 fast, 1 normal, 1 slow.

Jackjumpers = Fast/Normal strength

Ghouls = Normal/ Normal strength

Peircers = Slow/Very Strong, Critical hits.

The most monsters I've seen in one place was 2 piercers, 4 jackjumpers, and 3 ghoul things. You don't see many of them though, and only a few. :P

After you are equipped with a decent weapon, some armor, and good defense and fighting skills, it's easy and sometimes so boring you just end up throwing grenades around for fun because you've already blasted all the other monsters.
But don't get me wrong, at the start of the game they are very difficult to fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086151669', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1491736799}
review:
http://niveloculto.com/analisis-frozen-state/

rozen State tiene encanto. Esa clase de regustillo casero que tienen los proyectos hechos entre amigos, en este caso los tres (TRES, repito) Integrantes de Snow Arc Studio.
Aquí todos somos soñadores empedernidos. De ésos tipos raros que en el recreo nos reuníamos para dibujar con plastidecor el videojuego DE-FI-NI-TI-VO.

Ya sabes, ese juego-coctelera ambientado en un enorme mundo abierto pelín más grande que San Andreas, pero con los gráficos de Final Fantasy, donde montar en coche, era como hacerlo en Gran Turismo, pero cuando disparabas, era mejor que Max Payne, . ¿Ambición? ¿Dónde?

Con esta mentalidad, nos llega esta interesante propuesta:

Crafting Minecraftiano
25%
Humor y rol Fallout de los viejunos
40%
Supervivencia malrollera
35%
Fresquete siberiano
100%

Si te gustan estos ingredientes, y con la mentalidad de que nos hayamos ante una versión Alfa con mucho trabajo por delante,disfrutarás. Pero en el proceso, recordarás por qué no existe el cóctel definitivo, el videojuego que todo lo engloba: Siendo muy notable en todos estos aspectos, no alcanza la excelencia en ninguno.

Lastra la experiencia los clásicos defectos de un juego que se encuentra en una fase tan temprana de desarrollo: Enemigos idiotas, escenarios con poco incentivo para ser explorados, ropa que no afecta en absoluto la apariencia y una dificultad algo excesiva (Para un servidor). Resulta prometedor ver cómo todo fallo va siendo subsanado, y el contenido aumenta a buen ritmo.

Su elemento más destacado y distintivo es el frío. Esta bonita estampa navideña será la que va a acompañarte cada partida, y toca protegerse de ella. Esto añade tensión en el aspecto de la supervivencia a todos los niveles, desde no morir congelado mientras duermes a tomarte un cafecito reconfortante. Rara vez supondrá una amenaza insalvable, pero tampoco será extraño toparte con algún mutante en lo que buscas leña para el fuego…

Y si eso sucede, puedes darte por perdido. Los enemigos son absolutamente implacables cuerpo a cuerpo, y las balas escasean como mandan los cánones. Vas a morir decenas de veces, y cada vez que suceda, tanto los objetos como el mapa cambiarán aleatoriamente.

Unas veces tendrás suerte, otras empezarás literalmente en bolas, cambiando la experiencia de juego por completo.

Para gestionar un mapa considerablemente grande, se ha decidido dividirlo en cuadrantes. Su contenido siempre es el mismo (Un campo de fútbol, casas abandonadas, pura estepa siberiana…), pero su posición cambia a cada partida. Una forma inteligente de manejar grandes extensiones sin excesivos requisitos para nuestros maltrechos PCs.

Aún es pronto para tener un veredicto final , pero apunta maneras. No será nunca uno de esos juegazos recomendados en esta santa casa, porque no es su intención: Aquí se trata de un ejercicio de HAMOR, de combinar cual alquimista los elementos de los que más disfrutan sus creadores. Si tienes la suerte de tener sus mismos gustos, disfrutarás cosa bárbara, incluso ahora que le pesan todos los defectos de ser un juego en desarrollo.

Para todos los demás, nos toca esperar un poquito a que madure el proyecto, hasta su punto óptimo de consumo, bien frío.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104089191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1422956655}
review:
A good play! Not a jump in and do well right off the bat game. You start off in a random situation, always the same 'safe house' but your character has random things he starts with, in a random spot on the map. Then you need to make a plan, do I go out today, or can it wait? What do I really need? 
Then you go out, you learn quick that avoiding the infected is the best bet, because you may be able to fight off one of them, but they are not there for you to hack and slash through. Not a good plan to try that.
Even in EA state, this game is great. Just do be ready to die a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011974566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1442152167}
review:
Very interesting game!

I looked for a topdown survival game and i found "Frozen State"...

The first hours were very very creepy!

"Alone in the dark cold citiy of duga 40. Leaving the start shelter, looking for some fresh water and something to eat. The wind howls around me. The sun goes down - darkness and deep frost makes me sick... no shelter...by the last sun i see a small datscha - a shelter for the night?....fu** where are the matches?"


This could be your first experiance with this game. I was really excited!

So some opinions about the devs and the game:

Devs:
+ Fast replying at steam if there are issiues with an update
+ Updates come ca one eath month
+ Are very interested in the players suggestions and opinions

- At the moment nohing bad to tell about them ;D

Game:
+ Creepy athmospehre
+ Nice setting ( i like metro etc)
+ Interessting crafting and skill system
+ Many things to loot
+ Nice hearing and stealth system
+ You can travel on a map like fallout 1, your char lost heat, drinking etc
+ Easy to die, when you play like rambo...solid snake is the better way ;O)
+ Build own shelter and fortifications

- crafting is at an very primitive level, basic things to craft only
- no npc quest system 
- only a small part of the card can be travelled 
- low content for playing longer
- only three hybrid enemies


I thing these would be a great game! There are many things to do ... i will play the alpha and would be happy for each new content they made.

Play in progress, alpha version - when you accept this and like survival - just try ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198048722660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2307, 'last_played': 1477459216}
review:
首先，感谢游戏制作方对游戏的不断改进，让我对这游戏有着相当好的体验，从最早的EA版到现在，可以说不光玩游戏有不错的体验，伴随着游戏的成长更新也是不错的体验。

       2016年五一，随着最新的升级0.92 build 230的发布，我也不得不修改下评测了，具体不清楚是上个升级还是上上个升级，游戏出现了很大的变化，但是总体来说，游戏的类型没变，后面我会说下变化较大的地方。值得注意的是，看这次更新最后一段，官方似乎把文本独立了，方便翻译出各种语言，也就是说，汉化的可能性已经存在。

       这个游戏是一个上帝视角的生存游戏，基于现在的EA游戏版本，你的目的就是生存，这和大多数生存游戏开头差不多吧，但是这个游戏不像那些生存游戏，靠采集各种资源来强大自己，然后天下无敌接着开始无聊，这游戏的背景是一个废弃的世界，通过收集各种物品并制作一些对自己有利的工具来求生，游戏中有各种枪械，但是各种声音会很快把周围的敌人都吸引过来，你必需吃必需喝必需睡必需疗伤，你的目的不是建造基地然后再去探索，因为这样你多半会先玩死自己（当然去探索也会玩死自己），敌人可不只是怪物，严寒将会迫使你减少室外行动的时间，甚至让准备不充分的一次探索变成最后一次探索，作为一款另类的生存游戏，你的主场不再是荒野，而是各种建筑物内部，游戏的世界地图是随机生成的，而区域地图基本是固定的，也就是说每开次新档，就像在玩牌一样的随机抽取内容，但是区域地图也只限于建筑的布局是固定的，至于敌人的分布，各种物品等的分布也都是随机的。因为游戏角色拥有各种属性值，所以玩起来又很有俯视RPG的感觉。在后期的更新，应该会有剧情之类，和各种互动的NPC，目前你唯一的目的就是活下去。

      为什么我觉得这游戏不管是游戏体验，还是每次更新的体验都感觉很舒服。

      作为一款EA阶段的游戏，制作方的态度很不错，他们的更新很勤快，不光只是修复各种BUG，更有各种让人惊喜的新内容加入，而基本上他们提到的BUG我居然没怎么遇到，这点让这个游戏看上去不像半死不活的一些EA游戏，他们是很负责的。接着是最近的更新很让我吃惊，因为这游戏在之前还是和早期两个宣传视频一样，动作一般（现在更新的视频动作上可以看出和老视频的差距），显得僵硬死板，但是对游戏影响其实不大，生存游戏嘛，谁想，这最近的更新，真是duang的一下，游戏角色的动作进化了，不知道是不是制作方的人很喜欢合金装备，角色们一下子都会了CQC，简直变成了格斗游戏，各种攻击动作非常真实流畅，再也不像以前那样僵硬了，很生动，貌似还能用鼠标通过控制攻击方向发动各种腿技，并且还加入了闪避，不过也因为动作化的关系，耐力也加入了进去，现在打架没耐力可不行，也不知道官方为什么不更新视频，但是游戏这样进化了动作，确实给游戏一种很新颖的感受，添加了不少的乐趣，至少对我这样早期版本玩过来的，感觉变化真让人吃惊，以前我还喜欢躲着敌人，现在遇见重量级的敌人，都忍不住徒手上去来几下，不过手残，下场可想而知。

2016.8.7 看到我这段更新的补充注意一下吧，现在游戏正式发售了，但是这个我有点担心，因为游戏明显没做完全，只能看后期的更新，就像现在很多人的评价一样，游戏的完成度不太适合正式发售阶段。

author: {'steamid': '76561198121401722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1446314841}
review: I haven't played this game for a long time, but i feel like i have learned enough about this game to do a review on it.     First off, this game is great, the graphics, gameplay, and crafting are very good, for an Early Access game. I enjoyed looting every building in sight, hoping to get a nice weapon, or some useful supplies. This game focuses on survival, your obvious enemy are the zombies, but an uncommon enemy as well....the weather. The game takes place in Siberia, so obviously its gonna be snowing and cold, but that means that you cannot stay outside for long, or you will suffer from hypothermia. This game is very clever, you cant just stay inside one house the entire time, you will eventually have to go out and get supplies, so each time you go looting, it may be your last day. Another cool and uncommon feature is the sleeping mechanics, you can find beds, bathtubs, or sleeping bags to go to sleep, though you will have to put a campfire next to you, or you will freeze to death, also you can be killed in your sleep, by zombies. Overall, for an Early Access game, i will give it 9.5/10 i really like survival games, especially ones with zombies, and this game is really good. I totally recommend this game to anyone looking for a nice survival game, and i hope the Developers continue with the great updates. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198081185847', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1509654159}
review:
Frozen State : Premièrement, j'aimerais commencer à dire que je suis un Fan des Jeux de Survie! Quand nous parlons de Survie, il faut ce dire aussi que ça ne doit pas forcément être Facile et voilà toute la beauté de ce Jeu!

Pour Commencer, pour un Jeu qui est en Alpha, je trouve qu'il y a beaucoup d'éléments pour bien s'amuser durant de Bonne heures et aussi pour comprendre toutes les fonctionnalitées du Jeu vue qu'Il peut paraître complexe au Départ, mais on s'habitue rapidement! Le fait de devoir Survivre durant la période de l'hiver rajoute grandement de la Difficultée au Titre et cela n'est pas du tout gênant pour ma part, mais je peux comprendre que certaines personnes n'aime pas ce Système.

C'est pour cela que je conseille ce Jeu seulement à ceux qui veulent un bon Challenge quand même au niveau de la Survie dans ce Jeu! Il n'est pas facile! Pourquoi? De 1, il faut faire attention à la température de son Corps! Si vous courez, vous aurez plus chaud que si vous marcher. Si vous êtes dans un batiment qui n'a pas de fenêtre brisé et qui est bien isoler vous serez plus à l'abri du Froid qu'une maison sans fenêtres. À travers tout cela, il y a la Nuit qui est une période de la Journée ou le Froid est très Intense. Le Seul moyen de résister à ce froid est de faire un Feu de Camp. Oui, le Jeu intègre aussi le Craft, ce qui est un très bon Point. Vous pourrez crafter un bon nombre d'armes, d'outils, de Barricades etc etc. 

Le Plus difficile dans ce Jeu sont les Ennemis et je trouve même que cela est un Petit défault du jeu actuellement. Nous ne pouvons pas Parer les Coups des Mutants ou des Zombies! Cela rajoute énormément de difficulté vue que les Zombies frappent très Fort. Cela nous pousse justement à faire TRÈS Attention quand on croise certains Ennemis.

Bref, je ne vais pas m'éterniser plus Longtemps, c'est un Jeu pas chère actuellement et qui a beaucoup de Potentiel. Il est difficile actuellement, mais les choses peuvent Changer évidemment. Bref, je vous le Conseille pour ceux qui aiment la Survie ;)

Peace

D3ADMEURT, Youtuber Québécois

review:
THIS IS AN UPDATED REVIEW

I love this game, in fact it's now my favorite game that I have on Steam. Yes, I know that it's still in Alpha stage but It's already extremely fun. If you're suggesting of getting this game, get it. This game is worth the money right down to the half penny.
=========================================================================
I also have some thing that I believe to be bugs that can be fixable:

PROBABLE BUGS:
The light from the flashlight is always on, even though I don't have it equipped.

The light is also not coming from the character and sometimes it splits into two light beams when there isn't anything their.

Another thing is the lag, you need to fix this or less people will buy the game. just try to get the game to play as smooth as possible and more people could buy the game.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SUGGESTIONS:
Your character wearing clothing is visible in the game instead of only seeing it on the LUCA-12 when equipped to have them look different so the player doesn't have to look at the character wearing the same clothes even when you have something else equipped.

more types of Hybrids instead of just the Piercer, the Jackal Jumper, and the Gaunt.

You could also make wall break from explosives and from a large enough amount of damage from Hybrids.
==========================================================================
Here are some suggestions for new kinds of Hybrids:

The Climber:
The Climber can climb buildings and go through open passages like open doors, windows, and holes in walls.

The Chunker:
The Chunker can pick up rocks, debris, or even the player. It can also charge at you in a straight line

The Possesor:
The Possesor can control abandoned cars and can make them drive at you, and can catch your bullets and throw them back at you. The Possesor can also (if you take my third suggestion into account) throw cars through walls to get to you. You would probably think that something this tough would make the game impossible to survive but the Possesor's weakness will be a very low health that you can kill it in about five hits with a large kitchen knife.

I hope you take these into consideration.
                                                                                             Thank You, Cerxion

author: {'steamid': '76561198027075881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1462930562}
review:
After 17 hours of playing I can honestly say this game had me hooked.  Feels like the same game concept of Dungeon Seige, a great franchise.  

In the beginning I struggled to stay alive, usually dying because i had no water or matches to light a fire.  I also died a couple of times fighting the muties until I learned how to defeat them.  There are plenty of items to collect out there.  I stayed alive for days.  I found some back packs and could carry 250 of gear.  And I was.  I had to start dumping stuff.  Got caught in a small room by two muties.  Death comes in numbers.  When you die you start over.  Will this change?  Will you be able to save?  Maybe when all your bars are 100% a save feature comes up??

The C key for listening doesn't seem to work?  I had muties close and when I held down C I still could not hear them any clearer.  

Even in Alpha this is a good game.  Looking forward to the other aspects of the game getting fleshed out.  A big one being the skills pane.  As you progress you should get better at surviving.  There are very few guns and ammo.  Don't change that.  They are hard to use at range anyways.  Hence skill progression.  

A map would be great.  When i walk through the tansition zones I find myself getting turned around and going back to where I had already been.  Maybe thats on purpose?  It is dark and blowing snow at times, easy to get lost.  On the blowing snow topic.  I would say I played for about 10 to 15 game days and it was always the same weather.  Change it up.  It has to stop snowing sometime.  

One annoying thing.  You can crouch, which works for evading enemies.  But you can't jump?  This would be good for hopping over some of the small obstacles when running from enemies.  Instead of getting trapped and dying.  Again maybe this is on purpose?  Try to blend a little realism in the game.  I should be able to jump over small fences and debris if I'm fed, watered, warm and not injured.  Right??  Keep up the good work.  8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102302636', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1482562348}
review:
I can understand if people are nervous about paying for an Alpha game, however few alpha games are as good in there early states as this one. This is an Alpha game that has tremendous content very early on. 

It is a survival game but very few games make winter an enemy. Cold weather can kill you if your not paying attention to your temperture and if you decide to take on a hybrid, (the current enemy in the game) you have to be fast because some will kill you without thinking about it. This game is not a complete rougelike but if you die, you restart, and about ninety percent of the items and objects are procedural generated. Plus (as I said above) the enemies are as deadly as the weather itself.

Now the game is early so it has it's fair share of bugs, but from my experience I didn't come across any game breaking bugs and I play this game on a laptop with an Intel hd graphics 4000 (I did have to reduce some graphic settings). There's not much that I dislike about this game, the enemies are done right so far, keeping track of your characters health (food, water, etc..) isn't too bad, and having the random generation changes things up a bit.

The issues that I do have, is that there is no sprint button. So it takes a while to do certain things such as gathering wood to build your cabin. There's no map, so it's very easy to get lost if you don't keep track of what your doing. Also there's only three enemy types and there's only one that I try to avoid (fortunately more are going to be added soon). Besides that there isn't anything else that bothers me, I would highly recommend you try this. The Developer is very nice and he listens to people on the forums. Most devs don't do that. :)

You will get mad, because is really dark at night and you need battery to your flashlight.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972739270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1405199820}
review:
The game's definitely alpha. There's very little sound, very random gameplay, very few goals, and little to do once you've loaded up on fire, water, food, and have a good bed. My second game saw me sitting pretty with a bed, enough for 20+ campfires (each one lasts 6 hours), warm clothing, a week's worth of food ready to be cooked (lots of buckwheat and rice), and enough lemonade, tea, and tomato juice to match the food. I'd basically beaten the game.

But other than the jarring realization that you don't need to play anymore, it's got the makings of a good game. Doors that latch/unlatch, campfire cooking with crafted foods, good balance to monsters, and doesn't look half bad (though the protoganist could go for a revamp, and i was disappointed to note that equipment changes weren't reflected on him). Someone noted that they didn't like the movement, but i don't see anything weird with it. Pretty standard look-with-mouse and move-with-wasd controls, and the character doesn't slide around.

I don't know if i'd say it's more than a $5 game right now, but it's got promise. Make a reminder to check this out in 6-12 months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087242124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1419589354}
review:
An intriguing and intense surivival game.

Survival games as of late have drifted away from their core ideas, with many games being produced with points on action rather than pure survival, while others such as DayZ or Survivor Stories are often focused on multi-player. With Frozen State, produced by Snow Arc Studio, normally known for Mobile Apps, we see a clear return to the genre's roots.

Taking control of one of 3 characters, (only 1 available as of now), the player is thrust into an icy, post-apocalyptic world with meager supplies, and no bearing on their goal or object. Using a classic top-down view, the player must venture through the cold, and traverse numerous randomly placed 'Zones', complete with decrepit buildings, and the crumbling tenents of of former society. The wind and snow constantly blow, quickly chilling you to the bone, giving you the choice to to run for cover, or start a campfire to preserve your body temperature.

Supplies, food,  water, and sleep are constantly an issue, forcing you to scavenge every cabinet, fridge, chest, and pantry in order to survive your body's constant needs. Mutants also roam the wasteland, presenting another threat to survive, making you use found weapons to fight back against their presence.

All in all, a fantastic survival game that looks very promising.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030668893', 'num_games_owned': 1822, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1404695575}
review:
Mac version works well. I played on an Early 2009 Mac Pro, 16 GB RAM, Radeon 5870.

No bugs / glitches during play. I really liked the audio in the background, it provided a lot of atmosphere. Enemies were tough if you don't have good weapons. On my first play through I died fighting a monster with my fists. On the second playthrough I was able to find a lot of supplies raiding a 3 story apartment building (with a yeti monster inside). I was able to take out several enemies with either an ax or a firearm at range. The only thing I had to worry about was finding a place to sleep. I am glad you are including a sleeping bag because that was going to be one of my first suggestions.

The movement was different from what I expected (I thought you would use the mouse to change direction), but I found it actually provided some advantages such as running backwards and firing at enemies. The crafting is easy to use and intuitive (combining elements to make a meal, then putting them on a fire to cook them and make them edible). I like the different outfits (coats and hats) providing different defensive and temperature protection.

One big request is to get the map working. Moving through the different maps worked well, but it was hard sometimes to remember where the nearest bed is. One issue I noticed was going to one area then going back to a previous area, but your perspective was rotated 90 degrees. The camera could be rotated back, but since you don't currently have a map it was occasionally difficult to find my bearings. Also, if you could add notes to the map that would help.

Sometimes I would find a building / house with something blocking one of the doors outside (like furniture) and you are unable to cut through it. The only thing you seemed to be able to destroy were locked doors.

Some feature requests: key remapping - everyone has their favorite keys to perform actions. A save game feature - I had to finally kill myself in one game because I was bored and could not save it. Since you start out in the same house every time, how about adding a home base to store items and protect yourself?

I have been following this game since its Kickstarter campaign and I am very impressed with the progress the team has made. You have laid a solid basis for a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034035898', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1487623269}
review:
Замечательная олдскульная смесь Fallout и Wasteland, помноженная на атмосферу фильма "Нечто" Джона Карпентера.

Хорошая механика, добротная графика, типичный для данного жанра геймплей, отличная оптимизация. Видно, что игра находится на стадии Альфы, но уже сейчас проект смотрится очень и очень добротно. Плюсов у игры гораздо больше нежели минусов. 

Отличная атмосфера заваленного снегом советского городка пронизывает с самых первых минут игры. Советские и постсоветские пейзажи в видеоиграх всегда привлекали игроков не только из стран бывшего СНГ. Заснеженные машины, дома, бураны, сугробы, таящиеся в  руинах мутанты... игра просто пропитана атмосферой неизвестности и одиночества.

К значительным минусам игры можно отнести разве что механику ближнего боя, которая неоднозначна, и скорее даже плоха. Другой весомый минус - отсутствие карты, что очень мешает более глубокому и удобному исследованию мира игры, но карта находится в разработке, так что сошлем это на незначительные временные недостатки Альфы.
 
Так же стоит отметить, что в игре пока нечего делать, исследовать мир быстро надоедает, но в отличие от DayZ, PZ, Rust и прочих сурвайвл-проектов, разработчики обещают ввести сюжетную линию и квесты, что делает игре честь в будущем.

В целом, очень и очень многообещающий проект от российских разработчиков.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970841667', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1551394068}
review:
Frozen state does a wonderful job of portraying lonliness, the fight for survival, and a creeping sense of dread as you peer around every corner, and into every room. The game has randomized loot, crafting and survival elements, as well as monsters that remind me very much of the creatures from 'The Thing'. While the game is still in alpha and early release, I believe it is fully worth the pittance you pay for what could be hours of fun. As a plus, the developers seem to really listen to the comments people make, and take a keen interest in player suggestions to further develope and refine the gameplay. If you are like me, you'll love helping give the developers more ideas and create the game to be what you want it to be, unlocking the potential of community development. 

If you enjoy "breaking & entering / Treasure hunting" games based around survival of the elements and unknown enemies, as well as unforgiving consequences to every action and 'Permadeath' roguelikes, this is the game for you. If you prefer a more casual gaming experience, this may not be your cup of tea. 

In closing, I highly recommend this game to the more 'hardcore' crowd- Players which enjoy games like Project Zomboid, State of Decay, and DayZ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017563282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1431797530}
review:
[TIME OF REVIEW] [05/07/2014] [EARLY ACCESS BUILD 9]

Frozen State is one of the most interesting games I have seen in a while and after an hour of play I am ready to give out a review but first let me tell you some of my experiences in this game.

Day 1...

It's cold and i'm out of paper, I need to go out and find some if I am to make a campfire to survive.

I was attacked by some sort of infected known as a gaunt, It took a good hit on me but I am ok...I think.

It's getting dark and cold but I still have no paper I guess my only choice is to press on and hope for the best.

After searching around I found a run down house and saw something walk past the shattered window, I raised my gun and readied myself and slowly stepped towards the house. Before I got through the door I saw the horrific monster walking towards me, I fired a few bullets but I have had little experience shooting a gun so I missed 2/3 shots. I put it away and raised my axe and lunged at it taking a few good swipes at it knocking it down killing it. Once I had caught my breath I slowly walked into the same building when something more horrifc crawled across the ground at furious speed. I ran back terrified taking more shots but missing, I did as before and raised my axe slashing at it killing it. I'm not sure what it is but I really didn't want to know. I pressed on still looking for the paper I needed...

I found a supermarket but inside I found no paper although on my way out around the back something huge chased me, i'm not sure what it was but I ran and managed to escape.

Thankfully I was struck with the best of luck, a building full of apartments. I ran inside checking every drawer and cupboard but nothing until I checked an oven...And there it was, the one thing I had spent my journey looking for...Paper...I swiftly crafted myself a fire and crouched next to it, feeling the warmth as it brushed my skin...I am now in that appartment hoping that by morning I will still be alive...

I have decided to leave the room I was in, in search of more supplies. After a few minutes of searching I hear a loud crash as a wooden door breaks down, I stop dead in my tracks swiftly checking my surroundings...Suddenly a monster crawls along the ground towards me, I raise my axe once again and give it a few slashes but it keeps coming I try to give it another but a Gaunt begins his approach so I back into a small bathroom and whip out my pistol and fire an entire magazine at them...They are dead...I am now cold and dying...I rush around looking for the fire I left on so I could know where I was. I enter a room and see the thing I saw at the supermarket, it turns and begins its chase. I turn and run now looking for the exit. I run into a room hoping to find stairs but all I find is another exact same monster. I turn and run but he is right behind me. I manage to duke him out and continue my escape. Quickly I close a door to block them and run into another room...Empty...I turn back and see them already coming towards me, I try to doge him but to no avail, with one foul swoop he slices my neck cutting it open and I drop dead...


This was all in one small hour session and was a great thrillride, there was alot more I could have explored and seen but that would take far too long and be far to dangerous as I'm sure there are alot more terrifying creatures out there.

Things to improve/add:

Multiple saves - You can already do this by just copying the data folder and then deleting its contents except settings but it would make it alot easier than having to do that.

Getting around objects - I have seen various objects and such placed infront of doors and such and with no way to get around it, I think being able to climb over it or push things out of the way would be cool.

More crafting??? - I'm sure it will improve and add more but there isn't much atm anyway unless I just haven't found the right things although some things are there that I don't have but Idk.

More open worldy - Although the zone traveling does help FPS ALOT you can easily escape enemies by using zones when being chased which is a bit silly. Unless you can combat that with a sort of 'enemy nearby' system.

Mods - Of course mods 'cause why not?

Multiplayer - Although it's a big leap I think this game would be extremely good for MP as the core gameplay elements that are in the game such as lockpicking would make for some fun gameplay.

That's about all I can think of right now but my rating for this game as it is, is an 9/10.
The games concept is very unique and fun and even now I can see myself spending SO many hours in this game. Definately recommend this game!

Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PWI_xqPUOI

author: {'steamid': '76561198053292615', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1404738484}
review:
For those of you that want a video First Impressions, here you go :-

http://youtu.be/nQ1bZ3dsPMw

Pleasently surprised by this game. While the survival genre isn't exactly new (and let's face it, survival as a genre is very over-saturated these days) this game brings a rather unique twist with it being based very cold temperatures that make exploration need very careful planning, as one wrong decision can cost you dearly, either from freezing to death or the alien hybrids that have nothing better to do than to make your life a misery.

Interiors of buildings are randomly generated which in turn mean that items are also randomly generated. Your starting gear is also randomly generated to an extent too, which is rather nice as it brings a fair bit of variety. A decent example is that the first time I played I got a nice revolver with plenty of ammo. The second time round I didn't get a revolver and the third time I got a revolver but had the wrong ammo type.

The hybrids hurt, It is advised to try and avoid combat if possible (however you could go in guns/axes ablazing, just don't expect to be in one piece after though :p). You can sneak by crouching or walking to reduce noise you make, as far as I can tell it seems to work well enough.

While the controls can get a bit of getting used to, they work fairly well. Line of Sight is implemented very well in this game where you have a cone of sight that is movable with the mouse.

Really enjoying it so far, although I haven't put in as much time as I would like. Would love to see more crafting options, randomly generated maps (as well as interiors) and more functionality. I will be following the game to see how the devs expand the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063449504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1469832861}
review:
*Early Alpha Review*

Frozen State - Released in early Alpha today 7/1/14 I believe this game has a lot of potential and I am excited to see where the dev team will take it. My first playthrough I survived roughly 70 minutes. A brief tutorial gets you going with the basics and throughout my playthrough I found myself bringing up the Manual to check things such as crafting and whatnot. GAMEPLAY: In Frozen State's current 'state' do NOT expect a run and gun zombie killing game. I found it to be much more of a survival of the elements and finding safe places to sleep, cook food and stay warm. Most of my time was spent going from house to house looking through cupboards and bedrooms for useful items to either drink, eat or cook with. Building fires is absolutely necessary to stay alive along with finding safe places to sleep. As if surviving the subarctic tempurature isn't difficult enough, there are zombie-like creatures scattered thoughout the game. You start with a Nagant 7.62R pistol and an axe, the enemies (two varients that I have found so far) are not the most difficult to kill but I found myself avoiding them like the plague just because I was dying a slow death trying to stay alive without dealing with them. AUDIO/VIDEO: Both could use a little bit of work. I don't need my games, personally, to be the shiniest thing int he world but the visuals could maybe use some work. Noticed some animations were missing and some, like the flashlight I found, were really impressive adding to the overall atmosphere. Audio was OK, nothing to write home about at this point. 

In the end, I was freezing to death, getting hungry and becoming dehydrated. I was out at night during a snowstorm searching for safe shelter where I could build a fire and sleep. I stumbled across a huge building, I think it was a school, went it and went upstairs looking for either a bed or bathtub. I could hear creatures walking around and it was almost pitch black in the building so I had to move by flashlight and focus in on sounds. (You can hold "C" to focus on noises, I thought this was a really cool feature adding to the survival-horror feel) Was killed by a creature that walked on four legs, reminded me of the 'Licker' from a Resident Evil game.

All in all, I really think this is what survival horror is about. Excellent dark, gritty and isolated-survival aspects. Needs a lot of work but so far so good. They have a lot of content planned and I can only see good things for Frozen State. Worth the $10? Yeah, help the dev team out with your feedback and I believe we will all be well rewarded in the end. Enjoy!

*Edit: " I stumbled across a huge building, I think it was a school..." Literally. I found a few bottles of Port Wine and was #$%*ing wasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989976862', 'num_games_owned': 1904, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1634071866}
review:
Первая редакция (от 01.07.2014):
Одного часа достаточно чтобы сформировать первое мнение об игре. Оно под стать макаронам, что я варил в игре себе поутру, ежась от холода и раздувая тлеющие угли, потухшего за ночь костра. Хочу – еще. Вот это ощущение. Хочу сделать так чтобы игра вышла как можно скорее. И чтобы эта тема развивалась и дальше, в этом и в других проектах авторов. 

Но должен вас предупредить сразу, не стоит относиться к игре как к законченной, и ожидать от нее всего функционала. Он появится постепенно, и я уверен, не разочарует игрока. Пока все происходящее на экране можно назвать – хорошим демо. 

Frozen State обладает потенциалом. А это в категории «Ранний Доступ» дорогого стоит. Помимо интересного игрового сеттинга и аутентичной «советской» атмосферы, есть мир, который только ждет своего исследователя. Опасный. Холодный. Пронизываемый вьюгой, уныло воющей сквозь ставни разбитых окон. Разгромленный и заброшенный. Окружение настолько близко по духу, что всего несколько минут назад я поймал себя на мысли что вышел на улицу где-то на даче. Посреди зимы. И эти занесенные снегом теплицы всего лишь отголосок какого-то старого дня. Что, вот сейчас я, зайду обратно в дом, протяну руки к огню и буду согреваться обжигающим чаем сидя подле него.

Я уверен, со временем, мир станет больше, предметы обретут более глубокие описания, да и сами станут чем-то большим, чем иконки. Я уверен, что появятся квесты, журналы и другая информация о мире игры. Я уверен, что персонажи – станут настоящими персонажами и поведают нам свои истории. 

Как описать вкратце, что есть в игре, избегая лишних эмоций? Наверное списком. Так будет проще всего.  
•	В игре есть эксплорейшен (набор локаций)
•	Есть множество предметов 
•	Есть оружие, огнестрельное и холодное
•	Есть предметы, которые могут помочь выжить 
•	Есть крафт 
•	Есть противники 
•	Есть стелс 
•	Есть динамическая смена дня и ночи 
•	Последний в списке, но не последний по важности рандом объектов, предметов и декораций, так называемый shuffle. Где каждая новая партия - иная. 

Но разве может столь сухой список дать полное понимание атмосферы грядущего продукта? Сомневаюсь. 

Не стану скрывать я следил за Frozen State с самого начала. Не только как игрок, но и как разработчик. Меня восторгали концепты и мир созданный для игры. И для меня сильнейшим разочарованием стал тот факт, что игра не прошла кампанию на Кикстартер. Однако она обрела новых друзей, поклонников, и я надеюсь, что все они сейчас придут сюда. В этот морозный и холодный мир. Чтобы помочь разработчикам доделать начатое. Всем вместе. В «Раннем Доступе». Прошу прощения за столь эмоциональный обзор, но мне сложно оставаться равнодушным в отношении этой игры. 

В будущем я добавлю вторую редакцию, по мере прогресса в разработке игры. Назовем эту «рецензию» неким обзором на манер раннего доступа. Скетчем. Или первым впечатлением. Спасибо вам, разработчики, что не сдались после Кикстартера, и упрямо двигались к Стиму, преодолевая вьюги, метели и адский мороз.
